intro: Achillea melanolepis, commonly known as lesser yarrow, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of tiny flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with gray-green, fern-like leaves and small white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry meadows and rocky areas. Achillea melanolepis is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
